findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract allows minting of unlimited number of tokens without any restriction.

findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function allows unlimited spending of tokens by an arbitrary user without any restrictions or checks.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function is unprotected and can be exploited by attackers.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function is not properly protected, allowing unauthorized access and potential token theft.

findings.title: Unprotected increaseAllowance function
findings.description: The increaseAllowance function does not have proper access control or validation, allowing unauthorized users to increase allowance.

findings.title: Unprotected decreaseAllowance function
findings.description: The decreaseAllowance function is unprotected and can lead to unauthorized changes to allowance.

findings.title: Unprotected permit function
findings.description: The permit function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive functionality.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The mint function allows anyone to mint tokens without any access control or restrictions.

findings.title: Unprotected burn function
findings.description: The _burn internal function is unprotected and can be exploited.

findings.title: Unprotected swap function
findings.description: The private functions 'swapAndSendToFee', 'swapAndLiquify', 'swapTokensForEth', and 'swapTokensForCake' do not have any access modifiers or reentrancy protection, making them vulnerable to unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected skim function
findings.description: The skim function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized access and potential manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: Unprotected sync function
findings.description: The process function allows anyone to call it and update the state of the contract without any access control.

findings.title: Unprotected initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unprotected and can be called by anyone.

findings.title: Rebase function can be manipulated
findings.description: The rebase function can be manipulated by an attacker to drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Blacklist function can be bypassed
findings.description: The blacklist function can be bypassed, allowing unauthorized access or actions.

findings.title: Lock function can be exploited
findings.description: The lock function can be exploited due to its locked state.
